body: That's... quite an old version of gRPC. Any chance you can upgrade ?
@nicolasnoble, won't be able to upgrade in near future.
It's going to be very difficult to diagnose anything in such an old codebase, really. The Windows support especially got rewritten several times.
@nicolasnoble, I can understand that. Do you have any suggestion for me to diagnose this issue?

Unfortunately there isn't enough information from the errors pasted to see what the issue is. Clearly, the 'read' operation from the socket failed on the client side (perhaps the connection was explicitly closed by server or some other error - can't say).

Try turning on grpc traces (flags are here: https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/doc/environment_variables.md)
set the following env variables

`GRPC_VERBOSITY = DEBUG`
`GRPC_TRACE=all`
.. have you disabled Windows' firewall ? This trace simply states you weren't able to do a simple TCP connect.
Yes, I did disable Windows' firewall.

Looks like found the root cause of this issue. It turns out to be grpc server running on Windows Server leaks network connections. There are thousands of network connections are in CLOSE_WAIT state. Upgrading grpc from 1.0.0 to 1.15.0 helped resolved this issue.
